title: Establishes certification procedures for the profession of nurse anesthesia
summary: Establishes certification procedures for the profession of nurse anesthesia; provides for the issuance of a certification to practice as a certified registered nurse anesthetist upon the filing of an application, having a license as a registered professional nurse, having the appropriate educational requirements and paying the fifty dollar initial certification fee and the triennial thirty dollar registration fee.

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in  relation  to  the  profession  of
         nurse anesthesia

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Legislative  intent.  The  legislature  hereby  finds  that
    2  certified  registered nurse anesthetists are highly educated and trained
    3  advanced practice nurses who hold a national professional certification,
    4  and whose competency in the professional practice of nurse anesthesia in
    5  hospitals, free-standing ambulatory surgery  centers,  clinics,  profes-
    6  sional  offices  and  other facilities is well known. Nurse anesthetists
    7  are integral to the continued professional delivery of services in  such
    8  health care facilities throughout the state.
    9    The  legislature  further  finds  that  statutory recognition of nurse
   10  anesthetists will further enhance  patient  safety  by  codifying  their
   11  professional  scope of practice that is currently governed in this state
   12  by regulations promulgated pursuant to the public health law in the case
   13  of hospitals and ambulatory surgery centers.
   14    The legislature also finds that while nurse anesthetists are  advanced
   15  practice  nurses, licensed as registered professional nurses under arti-
   16  cle 139 of the education law, no provision  of  this  act  is  meant  to
   17  limit,  diminish  or in any way impinge upon the practice of the profes-
   18  sion of nursing as a registered professional nurse under such article.
   19    Therefore, the legislature hereby declares that, due to the  intrinsic
   20  nature  of  the administration of anesthesia services, the integral part
   21  that certified registered nurse anesthetists play in the  safe  delivery
   22  of  such  services and the need to protect and enhance patient safety in

    1  all health care facilities, it is in the interest of the people of  this
    2  state to recognize the national professional certification of registered
    3  nurse  anesthetists  and  that  the  existing scope of practice of nurse
    4  anesthesia,  as  currently practiced in this state, be codified in stat-
    5  ute.
    6    S 2.  Section 6902 of the education law is amended  by  adding  a  new
    7  subdivision 4 to read as follows:
    8    4.  (A) THE PRACTICE OF REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSING BY A CERTIFIED
    9  REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST, CERTIFIED UNDER SECTION SIXTY-NINE HUNDRED
   10  ELEVEN OF THIS ARTICLE MAY INCLUDE THE  PRACTICE  OF  NURSE  ANESTHESIA.
   11  NURSE  ANESTHESIA  INCLUDES:  THE ADMINISTRATION OF ANESTHESIA AND ANES-
   12  THESIA RELATED CARE TO PATIENTS; PREANESTHETICS EVALUATION AND  PREPARA-
   13  TION;  ANESTHETIC  INDUCTION, MAINTENANCE AND EMERGENCE; POST ANESTHESIA
   14  CARE; PERIANESTHETICS AND CLINICAL SUPPORT FUNCTIONS; AND  PAIN  MANAGE-
   15  MENT,  IN  COLLABORATION  WITH  A LICENSED PHYSICIAN QUALIFIED BY LAW TO
   16  DETERMINE THE NEED FOR ANESTHESIA SERVICES, PROVIDED SUCH  SERVICES  ARE
   17  PERFORMED  IN  ACCORDANCE  WITH A WRITTEN PRACTICE AGREEMENT AND WRITTEN
   18  PRACTICE PROTOCOLS. THE WRITTEN PRACTICE AGREEMENT SHALL INCLUDE EXPLIC-
   19  IT PROVISIONS FOR THE RESOLUTION OF ANY DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN THE COLLAB-
   20  ORATING PHYSICIAN AND THE CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST REGARD-
   21  ING A MATTER OF  ANESTHESIA  TREATMENT  THAT  IS  WITHIN  THE  SCOPE  OF
   22  PRACTICE  OF  BOTH.  TO  THE  EXTENT  THE PRACTICE AGREEMENT DOES NOT SO
   23  PROVIDE, THEN THE COLLABORATING PHYSICIAN'S TREATMENT SHALL PREVAIL.
   24    (B) PRESCRIPTIONS FOR DRUGS, DEVICES  AND  ANESTHETIC  AGENTS  MAY  BE
   25  ISSUED  BY A CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST, UNDER THIS SUBDIVI-
   26  SION AND SECTION SIXTY-NINE HUNDRED ELEVEN OF THIS ARTICLE,  IN  ACCORD-
   27  ANCE  WITH  THE PRACTICE AGREEMENT AND PRACTICE PROTOCOLS. THE CERTIFIED
   28  REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST SHALL OBTAIN A CERTIFICATE FROM THE DEPART-
   29  MENT UPON SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING A  PROGRAM  INCLUDING  AN  APPROPRIATE
   30  PHARMACOLOGY COMPONENT, OR ITS EQUIVALENT, AS ESTABLISHED BY THE COMMIS-
   31  SIONER'S  REGULATIONS,  PRIOR TO PRESCRIBING UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION. THE
   32  CERTIFICATE ISSUED UNDER SECTION SIXTY-NINE HUNDRED ELEVEN OF THIS ARTI-
   33  CLE SHALL STATE WHETHER THE CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE  ANESTHETIST  HAS
   34  SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETED SUCH A PROGRAM OR EQUIVALENT AND IS AUTHORIZED TO
   35  PRESCRIBE UNDER THIS SUBDIVISION.
   36    (C)  EACH  PRACTICE AGREEMENT SHALL PROVIDE FOR PATIENT RECORDS REVIEW
   37  BY THE COLLABORATING PHYSICIAN IN A TIMELY FASHION BUT IN NO EVENT  LESS
   38  OFTEN  THAN  EVERY  THREE  MONTHS. THE NAMES OF THE CERTIFIED REGISTERED
   39  NURSE ANESTHETIST AND THE COLLABORATING PHYSICIAN SHALL BE CLEARLY POST-
   40  ED IN THE PRACTICE SETTING OF THE CERTIFIED  REGISTERED  NURSE  ANESTHE-
   41  TIST.
   42    (D)  THE  PRACTICE PROTOCOL SHALL REFLECT CURRENT ACCEPTED MEDICAL AND
   43  NURSING PRACTICE. THE PROTOCOLS SHALL BE FILED WITH THE DEPARTMENT WITH-
   44  IN NINETY DAYS OF THE COMMENCEMENT OF THE PRACTICE AND  MAY  BE  UPDATED
   45  PERIODICALLY.  THE  COMMISSIONER SHALL MAKE REGULATIONS ESTABLISHING THE
   46  PROCEDURE FOR THE REVIEW OF PROTOCOLS AND THE DISPOSITION OF ANY  ISSUES
   47  ARISING FROM SUCH REVIEW.
   48    (E)  NO  PHYSICIAN SHALL ENTER INTO PRACTICE AGREEMENTS WITH MORE THAN
   49  FOUR CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETISTS WHO ARE NOT LOCATED ON  THE
   50  SAME PHYSICAL PREMISES AS THE COLLABORATING PHYSICIAN.
   51    (F)  NOTHING  IN THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE DEEMED TO LIMIT OR DIMINISH
   52  THE PRACTICE OF THE PROFESSION OF NURSING AS A  REGISTERED  PROFESSIONAL
   53  NURSE  UNDER  THIS ARTICLE OR ANY OTHER LAW, RULE, REGULATION OR CERTIF-
   54  ICATION, NOR TO DENY ANY REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE THE RIGHT  TO  DO
   55  ANY  ACT  OR  ENGAGE  IN  ANY PRACTICE AUTHORIZED BY THIS ARTICLE OR ANY
   56  OTHER LAW, RULE, REGULATION OR CERTIFICATION.

    1    (G) THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL NOT APPLY TO ANY ACTIVITY
    2  AUTHORIZED, PURSUANT TO STATUTE, RULE OR REGULATION, TO BE PERFORMED  BY
    3  A  REGISTERED  PROFESSIONAL  NURSE  IN  A HOSPITAL AS DEFINED IN ARTICLE
    4  TWENTY-EIGHT OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW.
    5    S 3. The education law is amended by adding a new section 6911 to read
    6  as follows:
    7    S 6911. CERTIFICATES FOR NURSE ANESTHESIA PRACTICE. 1. FOR ISSUANCE OF
    8  A  CERTIFICATE  TO  PRACTICE AS A CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST
    9  UNDER SUBDIVISION FOUR OF SECTION SIXTY-NINE HUNDRED TWO OF  THIS  ARTI-
   10  CLE, THE APPLICANT SHALL FULFILL THE FOLLOWING REQUIREMENTS:
   11    (A) APPLICATION: FILE AN APPLICATION WITH THE DEPARTMENT;
   12    (B)  LICENSE:  BE  LICENSED  AS A REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE IN THE
   13  STATE;
   14    (C) EDUCATION: (I) HAVE SATISFACTORILY COMPLETED EDUCATIONAL  PREPARA-
   15  TION  FOR  PROVISION  OF  THESE  SERVICES IN A PROGRAM REGISTERED BY THE
   16  DEPARTMENT OR IN A PROGRAM ACCREDITED BY A NATIONAL BODY  RECOGNIZED  BY
   17  THE DEPARTMENT OR DETERMINED BY THE DEPARTMENT TO BE THE EQUIVALENT; AND
   18  (II)  SUBMIT  EVIDENCE  OF CURRENT CERTIFICATION OR RECERTIFICATION BY A
   19  NATIONAL CERTIFYING BODY, RECOGNIZED BY THE DEPARTMENT;
   20    (D) FEES: PAY A FEE TO THE DEPARTMENT OF FIFTY DOLLARS FOR AN  INITIAL
   21  CERTIFICATE AUTHORIZING NURSE ANESTHESIA PRACTICE AND A TRIENNIAL REGIS-
   22  TRATION FEE OF THIRTY DOLLARS.
   23    AFTER A CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST'S INITIAL REGISTRATION,
   24  REGISTRATION  UNDER THIS SECTION SHALL BE COTERMINOUS WITH THE CERTIFIED
   25  REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST'S REGISTRATION AS A PROFESSIONAL NURSE.
   26    2. ONLY A PERSON CERTIFIED UNDER THIS  SECTION  SHALL  USE  THE  TITLE
   27  "CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST".
   28    3.  THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION SHALL NOT APPLY TO ANY ACT OR PRAC-
   29  TICE AUTHORIZED BY ANY OTHER LAW, RULE, REGULATION OR CERTIFICATION.
   30    4. THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION SHALL  NOT  APPLY  TO  ANY  ACTIVITY
   31  AUTHORIZED,  PURSUANT TO STATUTE, RULE OR REGULATION, TO BE PERFORMED BY
   32  A REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE IN A  HOSPITAL  AS  DEFINED  IN  ARTICLE
   33  TWENTY-EIGHT OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH LAW.
   34    5.  AN  INDIVIDUAL WHO IS AUTHORIZED TO PRACTICE AS A CERTIFIED REGIS-
   35  TERED NURSE ANESTHETIST IN A HOSPITAL UNDER REGULATIONS OF  THE  DEPART-
   36  MENT  OF  HEALTH  MAY USE THE TITLE "CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHE-
   37  TIST" IN CONNECTION WITH THAT PRACTICE.  IF SUCH AN  INDIVIDUAL  APPLIES
   38  FOR  A  CERTIFICATE UNDER THIS SECTION, HE OR SHE MAY SATISFY THE EDUCA-
   39  TION REQUIREMENT OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION BY PRESENTING SATIS-
   40  FACTORY EVIDENCE OF SUCH AUTHORITY.
   41    6.  (A)  A  REGISTERED  PROFESSIONAL  NURSE  LICENSED  UNDER   SECTION
   42  SIXTY-NINE HUNDRED FIVE OF THIS ARTICLE WHO HAS SATISFACTORILY COMPLETED
   43  A  PROGRAM  OF EDUCATIONAL PREPARATION AS PROVIDED IN SUBDIVISION ONE OF
   44  THIS SECTION MAY, FOR A PERIOD NOT TO EXCEED  TWENTY-FOUR  MONTHS  IMME-
   45  DIATELY  FOLLOWING  THE COMPLETION OF SUCH EDUCATIONAL PROGRAM, PRACTICE
   46  NURSE ANESTHESIA UNDER SUBDIVISION FOUR OF  SECTION  SIXTY-NINE  HUNDRED
   47  TWO  OF  THIS ARTICLE AS A GRADUATE NURSE ANESTHETIST IN THE SAME MANNER
   48  AS A CERTIFIED REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST UNDER THAT SUBDIVISION.
   49    (B) A REGISTERED PROFESSIONAL NURSE LICENSED UNDER SECTION  SIXTY-NINE
   50  HUNDRED FIVE OF THIS ARTICLE WHO IS DULY ENROLLED IN A PROGRAM OF EDUCA-
   51  TIONAL  PREPARATION,  MAY  PRACTICE  NURSE ANESTHESIA AS A STUDENT NURSE
   52  ANESTHETIST UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF AN ANESTHESIOLOGIST OR A  CERTIFIED
   53  REGISTERED NURSE ANESTHETIST, WHO IS IMMEDIATELY AVAILABLE AS NEEDED.
   54    7.  THE COMMISSIONER IS AUTHORIZED TO PROMULGATE REGULATIONS TO IMPLE-
   55  MENT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SECTION.
   56    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to the profession of nurse anesthesia
